result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody G. Saxby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cody G. Saxby is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cody G. Saxby was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Jane Ellen Bucher appearing on behalf of defendant. Cody G. Saxby, defendant does not appear.
Craig Nolen appearing as prosecuting attorney. Argument on restitution. Exhibit 1 from Defense marked and identified.  Court orders Defendant to pay restitution as a condition of probation, as determined by probation agent. Atty Nolen will submit a restitution order so the clerk may amend the JOC.
Restitution hearing on April 11, 2019 at 10:00 am.
Corrected JOC read aloud in court and approved by Atty Bucher after court, 01-10-19.

Cody G. Saxby, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Jane Ellen Bucher.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. Nunc pro tunc stipulation that sentence should have been ordered concurrent with any other sentence at that time of sentencing (08-07-17). Restitution amount named as $17,094.84 requested, to be paid to Wisconsin Crime Victim Compensation. Cody Saxby sworn in on oath by clerk and examined by Atty Bucher. Cross examined by Atty Nolen. Re-direct by Atty Bucher. Restitution removed from JOC and corrected JOC printed.  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 26, 2019 at 02:00 pm.

Per telephone conversation with Janelle Nehring of WI DOC (608-240-5334) and letter from Judge Beer of 08-09-18, Judgment of Conviction is Corrected to read "consecutive to sentence", and not any specific date or "period of incarceration".

records.addlTxt:
Cody G. Saxby, defendant appeared in Court in custody by video means from Illinois River Correctional Center with counsel Jane Ellen Bucher.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. No dispute as to amount of resitution requested by state. Request for hearing based on Defendant's ability to pay restitution. Defendant questioned by Atty Bucher and Atty Nolen as to financial situation and earning potential. Questioned by court. Arguments by Atty Bucher and Atty Nolen. Court denies Atty Bucher's motion. No restitution has been ordered yet.  Restitution hearing scheduled for December 11, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Restitution hearing on October 11, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
Brian S. S.
Victim Input Amended Possible Resolution
Restitution hearing on October 11, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Cody G. Saxby, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Jane Ellen Bucher. Jane Ellen Bucher appeared as prosecuting attorney.  State complied with Act 181 Victim Witness Notification. Amended Information filed. Court advises defendant of charges & penalties. Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated. Factual basis found.  Court addresses DE re: waiver of request for PSI. DA - sentence recommendation.  Victim addresses the court.  DA continues addressing the court. SPD Bucher addresses sentence recommendation, which involved hard negotiation issues. Defendant addresses the court. Court sentences. Defendant advised of firearm restriction. Defendant advised of voting rights.
After court - Judge confirms Count 2 dismissed. Clerk removed Jury Trial from the court calendar.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 7, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Cody G. Saxby, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Jane Ellen Bucher. Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. Note taking allowed. 12 person jury trial plus 1 alternate. 35 person panel. 5 strikes each. Possible that case will be resolved before jury trial date.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

May not possess or consume any intoxicants.  May not enter establishments that sell intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.
